intro: Adenema, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. These plants are characterized by their large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to purple flowers. Adenema species are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in wet or disturbed soils.
